shelley.name: Shelley Townsend
shelley.description: Shelley D. Townsend, born in Houston, Texas, began her artistic journey in Europe, where her family moved to support her mother's opera career. Living in Paris and Milan for eleven years, she was inspired by Italian sculptor Ernesto Ornati to pursue sculpture. Townsend honed her craft at Loretto Heights College in Denver, Colorado, earning BFA degrees in both Sculpture and Painting. Her career flourished in New York City and later in Connecticut, where she studied under Peter Rubino. Now back in Houston, Townsend has produced a significant body of work and enjoys teaching sculpture, sharing her passion for creating beauty in its most natural form.

bailey.name: Bailey Ryherd
bailey.description: Bailey Ryherd is a versatile artist with over a decade of experience in polymer clay sculptures, digital art, ink drawings, and concept art. Since 2010, she has taken commissions, creating unique and imaginative pieces that showcase her diverse skills and dedication to her craft.

olesia.name: Olesia Y. Rodionova
olesia.description: Ladymilkydeer is a versatile visual and conceptual artist whose work spans traditional and digital mediums, including watercolor, algorithmic art with Processing, blackwork tattooing in a neo-traditional style, and brand conceptualization for the fashion industry. An AI enthusiast with a focus on AI ethics, she explores the intersection of future technologies and human identity, pushing contemporary aesthetic boundaries. Originally from Ukraine, she began her U.S. career in 2023 with "Dreaming. POV: you are an android," a Processing project showcasing an android’s perspective in sleep mode. Since then, she has participated in over ten collective art shows at Hardy and Nance Studio, the "Don’t Call Me Sweetie" show by Insomnia Gallery, and has been published in the fubar.space 2k23 online catalogue with a glitch art project for a fashion brand.
